session_summary: Audrey and Andrew caught up at 8:32 pm on 3 July, 2023. Audrey mentioned taking a challenging but rewarding dog training course while Andrew expressed difficulty finding pet-friendly spots. They discussed their lack of time for exploring trails but Audrey shared how well her dogs were doing due to the training. Andrew admired her dogs and asked about their breeds and favorite activities. Audrey revealed they were all mutts who loved running and playing fetch. They further discussed the age of the dogs, their good relationship, and a recent doggy playdate. Andrew shared his new hobby of cooking while Audrey disclosed her love for it and her favorite recipe, Chicken Pot Pie. Andrew showed interest in trying the recipe, and Audrey planned to share it. They also discussed the therapeutic nature of cooking and the joy of trying new dishes. Audrey mentioned garlic as her go-to ingredient and offered to share a Roasted Chicken recipe inspired by Mediterranean flavors. Andrew expressed excitement to try it and thanked her for sharing, ending the conversation with plans to talk later.

conversation_turns.speaker: Audrey
conversation_turns.text: Hey! It's been a while. I'm taking a dog training course and it's challenging but rewarding. My dogs are doing better already. What's new with you?

conversation_turns.speaker: Andrew
conversation_turns.text: Hey great to hear from you! Life's thrown me a few curveballs lately. Still can't seem to find any dog-friendly spots to rent. That's a bummer. Have you been able to do any exploring on new trails?

conversation_turns.speaker: Audrey
conversation_turns.text: Aw, sorry about the search for dog-friendly spots. I haven't had a ton of time for new trails either. The dog-training course has been a big time sink but it's paid off because they're doing great.

conversation_turns.speaker: Andrew
conversation_turns.text: That's great news! It must feel so rewarding to see them doing well. I understand how it feels on missing the peace of being out on the trails, but for now, it's just urban adventures then.

conversation_turns.speaker: Audrey
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photo of two dogs running in a field with a ball in their mouth
conversation_turns.text: Seeing them do well is super rewarding! They give me so much love and happiness. I get how frustrating it can be not to find pet-friendly spots. Nature is so calming and restorative with them around. See how happy they are when they're out.

conversation_turns.speaker: Andrew
conversation_turns.text: I don't think I ever asked what breed they are right? Also, what do they enjoy doing the most? Looks like they're having a blast!

conversation_turns.speaker: Audrey
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photo of two dogs curled up in a dog bed
conversation_turns.text: They're all mutts. Two of them are Jack Russell mixes and the other two are Chihuahua mixes. They love running and playing fetch, you should see them sometimes.

conversation_turns.speaker: Andrew
conversation_turns.text: They look so comfy in that bed. It's clear they're well loved. How old are they? How are they getting along now?

conversation_turns.speaker: Audrey
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photo of two dogs laying on a couch with a blanket
conversation_turns.query: dogs cuddling together playdate at home
conversation_turns.text: They're all 3-year-old and they are a great pack. We had a doggy playdate last Friday. It was a bit crazy but still lots of fun!

conversation_turns.speaker: Andrew
conversation_turns.text: They look adorable! Doggy playdates sound like a lot of fun. Glad they all get along.

conversation_turns.speaker: Audrey
conversation_turns.text: Thanks! They really are my universe. So anything new you've been into lately?

conversation_turns.speaker: Andrew
conversation_turns.text: Lately I've been finding new hobbies since I can't hike. I've been getting into cooking more and trying out new recipes - it's been enjoyable. Do you enjoy cooking? Any favorite recipes?

conversation_turns.speaker: Audrey
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photo of a pie on a wooden board with a knife
conversation_turns.text: I love cooking! My favorite recipe is Chicken Pot Pie. It's so cozy and delicious, especially on a cold day. If you want, I can share the recipe with you.

conversation_turns.speaker: Andrew
conversation_turns.text: Mmm that looks nice! Mind sharing the recipe so I can give it a try? What inspired you to make it?

conversation_turns.speaker: Audrey
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photo of a pie with a lattice on top of it
conversation_turns.text: Sure! Let me send you the recipe in a bit. You really should give it a try! It's my family's recipe that's been around for years. The flavors always remind me of my grandma's kitchen - makes me think of all the conversations we used to have at the table. I hope you like it! Oh, and how's the cooking going?

conversation_turns.speaker: Andrew
conversation_turns.text: Thanks! I'll give it a try. Cooking has been helping me de-stress and be creative. I'm still a rookie, but I'm having fun experimenting. So what makes you like cooking so much?

conversation_turns.speaker: Audrey
conversation_turns.text: I love trying out new recipes and experimenting in the kitchen - it's like an escape for me. It's great for de-stressing and letting my creativity flow.

conversation_turns.speaker: Andrew
conversation_turns.text: Oh I feel you! It gives me an escape and allows me to try something new. Plus, there's always the bonus of enjoying the food afterwards. It's slowly becoming one of my favorite hobbies, as it's really relaxing and allows me to express my creativity.

conversation_turns.speaker: Audrey
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photo of a plate of food with a lot of vegetables
conversation_turns.text: Agreed! Cooking and eating the food is so rewarding; it's like a form of self-care. I love throwing on some music, pouring a glass of wine, and just going with the flow in the kitchen. It's so therapeutic. See how beautiful this dish is?

conversation_turns.speaker: Andrew
conversation_turns.text: Ooo, that looks great! Cooking can be so calming, right? What's your go-to ingredient in the kitchen?

conversation_turns.speaker: Audrey
conversation_turns.text: Yeah! Cooking is definitely calming. Garlic is my go-to ingredient. I love the smell and taste it adds to dishes.

conversation_turns.speaker: Andrew
conversation_turns.text: Garlic is indeed delicious! Do you have a favorite dish that you like to make with it? If so, would you like to share the recipe?

conversation_turns.speaker: Audrey
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photography of a pan of chicken and potatoes on a stove
conversation_turns.text: Sure! Roasted Chicken is one of my favorites - sure I'll send you the recipe in a bit.

conversation_turns.speaker: Andrew
conversation_turns.text: Wow I can't wait to make it! That looks amazing. What inspired you to make it?

conversation_turns.speaker: Audrey
conversation_turns.text: I'm glad you're interested! This recipe is based on my love for Mediterranean flavors. It's a tasty dish that's easy to make and loaded with healthy stuff like chicken, garlic, lemon, and herbs. It's my favorite comfort meal!

conversation_turns.speaker: Andrew
conversation_turns.text: Wow, that sounds delicious and healthy! I'm always looking for new meal ideas, especially ones that are healthier. Really appreciate you sharing this with me, thanks!

conversation_turns.speaker: Audrey
conversation_turns.text: No problem! I hope you enjoy making and eating it. Let me know how it turns out!

conversation_turns.speaker: Andrew
conversation_turns.text: Yep, will do! I'll keep you posted. Talk later!

conversation_turns.speaker: Audrey
conversation_turns.text: Excited to hear about it. Talk later!

Audrey: Audrey enrolls in a dog-training course to improve her ability to take care of her dogs.
Andrew: Andrew explores the hobby of cooking to compensate for not being able to hike much within the city.

Audrey: Audrey is taking a dog training course and it has been challenging but rewarding.
Audrey's dogs are all mutts, with two being Jack Russell mixes and the other two Chihuahua mixes.
Audrey's dogs are all 3 years old and get along well as a pack.
Audrey's favorite recipe is Chicken Pot Pie, a family recipe that reminds her of her grandma's kitchen.
Audrey loves trying out new recipes and experimenting in the kitchen as an escape to de-stress and let her creativity flow.
Audrey's go-to ingredient in the kitchen is garlic, for the smell and taste it adds to dishes.
Audrey loves to throw on some music, pour a glass of wine, and cook as a form of self-care and therapy.
One of Audrey's favorite dishes to make is Roasted Chicken, inspired by her love for Mediterranean flavors and as a comfort meal.
Andrew: Andrew is finding new hobbies such as cooking more and trying out new recipes.
Cooking has been helping Andrew de-stress, be creative, and express his creativity.
Andrew finds cooking calming and a form of escape that allows him to try something new.
Andrew appreciates cooking as a relaxing activity that he enjoys, especially the process of experimenting.
Andrew is interested in trying new meal ideas, especially healthier ones.
